title: Because And Because Of | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: We cancelled the trip ........................... the rain.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: It was ............................... you that I got into trouble.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object.

questions.question: We hurried indoors ........................... it started raining.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object

questions.question: I was late ........................... I missed the train.
questions.description: Here the conjunction because is followed by the clause 'I missed the train'. Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object

questions.question: We couldn't work .............................. the power outage.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object. Here the noun phrase 'the power outage' is the object of the preposition 'because of.

questions.question: I passed the test easily ........................... I had studied well.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object

questions.question: She can't walk ........................... arthritis.
questions.description: Because of is a preposition and as such it needs a noun or pronoun after it. Arthritis is a noun.

questions.question: Hundreds of people lost their jobs .............................. recession.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object

questions.question: He found working in China quite difficult ............................. he didn't understand Chinese.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object.

questions.question: We couldn't understand him ........................... his accent.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause. Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun which acts as its object. Here the expression 'his accent' acts as the object of the preposition 'because of'.

questions.question: She quit her job ............................... she wanted to spend more time with her children.
She ate only a salad ............................. she is a vegetarian.
